post: 📜  #OTD in 1957, President Eisenhower issued Executive Order 10730, sending federal troops to protect the Little Rock Nine as they integrated Central High School. How can this moment help students understand the role of the federal government in protecting rights? Check out this lesson:  https://bit.ly/3YdZvqS  #TDiH  #CivilRights  #CivicEducation  #EqualProtection

The 2025–2026 MyImpact Challenge is here! Students nationwide are designing civic projects that embody Americas founding principles and prepare the next 250 years of self-government. 🔗 Support the next generation of leaders:  https://bit.ly/3fyGGr3  #MyImpactChallenge  #CivicEducation  #StudentVoice  #America250  #CivicEngagement

What does it take to prepare the next generation for self-government? At the Bill of Rights Institute, we believe it takes hands-on learning, authentic engagement, and opportunities for students to see themselves as civic leaders. On September 17, more than 750 students in Bay City, Michigan joined us for Civicspalooza, a daylong celebration of Constitution Day filled with civics competitions, debates, civic action workshops, and connections with local leaders. Events like Civicspalooza remind us that civic education is not just about knowledge of history and government, its also about empowering young people to embody constitutional principles like equality, justice, and liberty in their daily lives. 🔗 Read more about Civicspalooza and BRIs work:  https://bit.ly/424ZW82  #CivicEducation  #ConstitutionDay  #StudentVoice  #Leadership

What does it mean to be a civic leader? Sometimes, its as simple as noticing a problem and acting responsibly with your community to solve it. Watch our new Civic Leader video and see how young leaders can make change. 🔗 Watch now:  https://bit.ly/42GpSHh  #ConstitutionDay  #CivicEducation  #CivicVirtues  #Leadership

Were grateful to APP2Speak® for supporting BRIs Civics for Everyone initiative. Their photo-based AAC app empowers nonverbal students to share their voices, ensuring every learner can engage in civic dialogue. Learn how you can support our work: bit.ly/4jBYuQp  #CivicsForEveryone  #AAC  #AccessibilityMatters  #StudentVoice  #EdEquity

📜  #OTD in 1796, George Washingtons Farewell Address was published in The American Daily Advertiser, offering guidance on unity, partisanship, and foreign policy. How can these ideas shape civic leadership today? Lesson on Washingtons integrity:  https://bit.ly/4pom9YV  #TDiH  #CivicEducation  #CivicLeadership  #AmericanHistory

Friendly challenge: Which state will put the most Pocket Constitutions into students hands this month? Back your state and tag a friend to join you. Give:  https://bit.ly/40EsBAg  #CivicsChampion  #StatePride  #CivicEducation  #SupportTeachers

How did John Dickinson, the Penman of the Revolution,  shape the American founding? Historian Jane Calvert joins BRI Scholar Talks to unpack his ideas on prudence, liberty, and constitutional design. Watch and share your takeaway:  https://bit.ly/4n5sjvj  #CivicEducation  #AmericanFounding  #JohnDickinson  #Constitution  #ScholarTalks

How do state and federal powers shape our constitutional rights? In this interview, Kirk Higgins and Anastasia Boden discuss federalism, liberty, and the vital role of the judiciary branch. Watch now:  https://bit.ly/4n9iBIt  #CivicEducation  #Federalism  #Constitution

Your next hotel booking could fund a classroom ✈️ With TravelingToGive, part of every trip you take supports the Bill of Rights Institutes mission to provide free civic education. Where will your travels take you? 🧳 Start here:  https://bit.ly/43XWUUk  #TravelingToGive  #CivicEducation  #SupportTeachers  #TravelForGood
